Message.Msg: There's a difference between thinking you're patriotic and actually being patriotic. I'm sure most of you Tea Brains consider yourselves honest too. . .

Yes, I do know. I am not an absolute moron. How do you think Obama's support of homosexual rights squares with Sharia law? What about the way he treats his wife and daughters? I don't know if you intentionally spread this BS or if your just a dumb consumer of it, but it is completely idiotic to link Obama to sharia law in any way shape or form. It is irresponsible, unpatriotic, and exactly what I expect from you Tea Brains.

Topic.Title: Never Bully ... like in You're Chicago !!

Another point ref: 'reading & comprehension" .. HEY EGGO, your rebuttlal to the Frogg's post of the "Independence Day" Topic (??) .. maybe you should stick to your critiqing of spelling & punctuation of the English Language .. NOT the Comprehension there OF, because THAT really "sux" His "Indepenence Day" post had nothing to do with ANY 'President's' popularity, or lack of !! .. (ya silly ole coot .. smiles)

...“…I don't know if you intentionally spread this BS or if your just a dumb consumer of it…” -ricky If we were dealing with real people here, and not simply shills spewing nonsense, think what a logical response might be as a result of your post. Like winholder, saying something like, “Ya’ know, you’re absolutely right. For me to say that the duly elected President of the United States is even remotely connected to, or approving of, Sharia law, is really a very stupid statement, with no basis of fact whatsoever. You know sometimes I read this stuff and just pass it along because I WANT to believe it. I’m really not as stupid as the people who originate this birther/swift boat stuff, and I’m nowhere near as ignorant as the fools who actually believe it. It’s really very unpatriotic to suggest that our President wants harm to come to our country, and I apologize for saying silly things with no basis of fact, just because some of us very much dislike this President.” What do ya’ think, winholder? Rather than your usual excuse of “I didn’t say those exact words”, admit that you said – quote – “He shouldn't denounce Sharia Law. He knows it and likes it.” It would be nice if you would either provide some evidence that our sitting president likes sharia law, or in the absence of corroborating evidence, how about apologizing for a change? For the sake of your own credibility, why don’t you man up for once in your life?
"icky" says he's not an absolute moron .. mmm ??? Well icky, would you want to try a T-board poll on that statement ?
"Crown thy good, with brotherhood." That's in a song about America. Brotherhood is the crown of America. The right wing haters aren't doing that, especially towards our President.

I haven't been fed anything, the facts are there to see. It's you who have been fed BS and poisoned by beck, rush, etc, with lies about our President. Since he has been elected twice I don't see the reason for it. Once you're deep into it like you are, you ignore facts.

Topic.Title: What have we learned today from our MSM?

Message.Msg: "I thought you believed in our justice system and our Department of Justice?" I do believe in the American system of justice, which is why I wanted a trial. What I am not entirely sure is why you are admonishing me about "jumping to conclusions" and not Froggie, who has clearly convicted Martin of assault and thinks he had no right to defend himself--using only his fists--from an armed stranger who was following him in the middle of the night. It is amazing to me that you people cannot seem to fathom that maybe Martin was just a kid, walking home from the store, who got scared when some creep started following him. That is because you are judging this circumstance on race. If same thing happened to a white kid, Froggie, Lavendar and all of you Tea Brains would be crying about how a Hispanic guy got away with shooting a white kid. You are all so very transparent. This is America. Having to explain why you shot and killed an unarmed person under very questionable circumstances before a jury of your peers is not a travesty. I do not know what the outcome of the trial will be. But I do know that Martin was doing nothing wrong that night. I do know (from Zimmerman's own account) that Zimmerman followed Martin against police advice, that Martin tried to approach and speak to Zimmerman but Zimmerman refused to respond or to identify himself, that Martin tried to run away, and that Zimmerman followed Martin even after he tried to run away. If some creep did that to me, you better believe I'd be defending myself.

Topic.Title: What have we learned today from our MSM?

Message.Msg: From what I have seen of the trial so far it appears to be a tragic failure to communicate. Martin didn't know who Zimmerman was and neither one of them took the time to find out what the other was doing. Martin was too anxious to demonstrate his MMA training and Zimmerman missed with his "warning" shot.

Topic.Title: What have we learned today from our MSM?

Message.Msg: You have got to have sympathy for someone with an IQ that low. I think she was trying to be honest and help as much as she knew how. I give her an A for effort.

Message.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck
Message.Msg: I belong to the cwa1298/Connecticut which has to be the worst union on the planet...can someone tell me the steps to stop paying my union dues.....hers just 1 example...me and my coworkers filed a grievance 6 years ago about contractors doing our job and working all of our overtime...well 2 days after the contract was approved by a vote of 900 to 640 ...att decided to cancel the arbitration date which was the next date and my union the cwa said sure...but they never requested a new date. This date was set up 10 months ago....this union and its executive board are the worst of the worst and its time to hurt them in the pocketbook...we have over 100 grievants who want to do the same...thanks

Topic.Title: What have we learned today from our MSM?

Message.Msg: All races should be tolerant of racist remarks because they are all born of ignorance. Those making the remark are more to be pitied than vilified. Let's all join Dr King in his dream and make it more than a dream.

Topic.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck

Message.Msg: There is very little that I can be proud of in California but this is one. The law in California allows all workers the right to designate an amount equal to their union dues be given to the charity of their choice instead of to the union. Circulate a petition to get it on the Connecticut ballot for 2014. Better hurry.
Obama is watching the T board so I won't use capital letters to say I long for the day our military takes back the USA. Maybe we need to demonstrate to get their attention.

Message.Title: Obama's transparent government
Message.Msg: He is delivering what he promised. He already knows more about the population of the United States than any previous president did. If you thought he meant we would know more about the government you just misunderstood him.

Topic.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck

Message.Msg: Call your payroll dept .. all deductions from your check, you have to sign an authorization form. They also should have forms for all changes or re-allocation in your deductions. If not, they can guide you. Good luck .. (former IBEW guy)

Topic.Title: What have we learned today from our MSM?

Message.Msg: Well. I'm not sure I'd go as far as an 'A' ? I was thinking more of an 'R' for re-do. or repeat ... back to at least the 4th grade. And make sure she gets into a full 25/25/25/25 ratio intergrated school, so she can learn which phrases are derogatory. Also, to stay away from street punks.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ...“Thou art weighed in the balances, and art found wanting.” - Daniel “The passion for seeking the truth for truth's sake...can be kept alive only if we continue to seek the truth for truth's sake.” – Franz Boas "What a bad week for the stock market. Yesterday was so bad the numbers looked worse than a Paula Deen talk show on the BET network." - Jay Leno “ I remember once quarreling with Yeats who was walking around the room with a sword in one hand muttering spells to ward off evil spirits, and I noticed that every time he passed a plate of plums he put down his unoccupied hand and took a plum and I said, 'Yeats, you cannot evoke great spirits and eat plums at the same time’." – George William Russell “My theory is that we are all idiots. The people who don’t think they’re idiots — they’re the ones that are dangerous.” – Eric Sykes "President Obama was in Germany and made a historic speech. The reason Obama was in Germany was to promote democracy and to rescue Justin Bieber's monkey." - David Letterman “My generation of radicals and breakers-down never found anything to take the place of the old virtues of work and courage and the old graces of courtesy and politeness.” – F. Scott Fitzgerald “I was looking for myself and asking everyone except myself questions which I, and only I, could answer.” – Ralph Ellison “The NSA says they have developed a robotic bird that looks and flies like a bird to use for surveillance. So if you see a bird outside your window tweeting with a BlackBerry, it's spying on you." - Jay Leno “The fact that logic cannot satisfy us awakens an almost insatiable hunger for the irrational.” – A.N Wilson

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ...“Conceit, arrogance and egotism are the essentials of patriotism. Let me illustrate. Patriotism assumes that our globe is divided into little spots, each one surrounded by an iron gate. Those who have had the fortune of being born on some particular spot consider themselves nobler, better, grander, more intelligent than those living beings inhabiting any other spot. It is, therefore, the duty of everyone living on that chosen spot to fight, kill and die in the attempt to impose his superiority upon all the others…” – Emma Goldman “In the abundance of water a fool is thirsty.” – Bob Marley "The Girl Scouts announced that their pension plan has a $347 million deficit. The Girl Scouts are $347 million in debt so in addition to teaching girls about camping it also is preparing them for careers in government." - Jay Leno “The discipline, nonetheless, is exacting: everything that can be observed should be observed, even if it is only recalled as the bland background from which the intriguing bits pop out like Venus in the evening sky. The goal is always finding something new, hopefully unimagined and, better still, hitherto unimaginable.” – K. Barry Sharpless “American Beer is a lot like making love on a canoe - it's focking close to water.” – Eric Idle "Over in the Senate, they found a way to get Republicans on board with immigration reform. They're going to militarize the border. They're going to build a border surge. … Sounds like something you eat at Taco Bell. Or something that happens after you eat at Taco Bell." - Bill Maher “Well, I think we do have to define torture. One man’s torture is another man’s CIA’s sponsored swim lesson.” – Rachel Marsden “The sea, the great unifier, is man's only hope. Now, as never before, the old phrase has a literal meaning: We are all in the same boat.” – Jacques Cousteau "The Supreme Court has ruled the Defense of Marriage Act is unconstitutional. Once someone explains this to me I'm sure I'll be thrilled about it. Listen to what happened. Earlier today, Rush Limbaugh's head exploded." - David Letterman “Often, the less there is to justify a traditional custom, the harder it is to get rid of it.” – Mark Twain

Message.Title: AHQ (3)...
Message.Msg: ...“A bunch of money-grubbin', greenhouse-gasing, seal-clubbing, oil-drilling, Bible-thumping, missile-firing, right-to-life-ing, lethal-injecting hypocrites. People whose idea of a good time is strapping a dead panda to a Lincoln Navigator and running over everybody in the gay parade.” – Richard Jeni, on the right wing “A bunch of bong-smoking, America-bashing, flag-burning, yoga-posing, incense-burning, dolphin-saving, salmon-eating hypocrites. These are the sensitive, liberal people who are always yelling about people's freedom of speech and expression, unless you happen to say something that #$%$ them off.” – Richard Jeni, on the left wing "Last night the White House staff played softball against a team made of marijuana lobbyists. Which explains why there were 20 hits before the game even started." - Jimmy Fallon “Make your ego porous. Will is of little importance, complaining is nothing, fame is nothing. Openness, patience, receptivity, solitude is everything.” – Rainer Maria Rilke “You ever hear girls say that? "I'm not religious, but I'm spiritual." I like to reply with "I'm not honest, but you're interesting!" – Daniel Tosh “Now that the Supreme Court has overturned the Defense of Marriage Act, this ruling means California gay guys can finally marry someone other than Liza Minnelli." - Jay Leno “Fretting about a dearth of randomness seems like worrying that humanity might use up its last reserves of ignorance.” – Brian Hayes “We must question the story logic of having an all-knowing all-powerful God, who creates faulty Humans, and then blames them for his own mistakes.” – Gene Roddenberry "A new survey found that 70 percent of Americans admit to 'going through the motions' at their jobs. And the other 30 percent blah, blah, blah, punch line." - Jimmy Fallon “Sir, as a man advances in life, he gets what is better than admiration - judgement, to estimate things at their true value.” – Samuel Johnson

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ...“Everyone’s a pacifist between wars. It's like being a vegetarian between meals.” – Colman McCarthy “In our culture, we think that happy and color is trivial, that black and darkness is deeper. But Nietzsche said - which is a line that I firmly believe – ‘Joy is deeper than sorrow, for all joy seeks eternity’.” – Julie Taymor "Syrian President Assad crossed a red line. He used chemicals weapons. Using harmful chemicals to hurt your own people – who does he think he is, Monsanto?" - Bill Maher “This is not remarkable, for, as we know, reality is not a function of the event as event, but of the relationship of that event to past, and future, events. We seem here to have a paradox: that the reality of an event, which is not real in itself, arises from the other events which, likewise, in themselves are not real. But this only affirms what we must affirm: that direction is all. And only as we realize this do we live, for our own identity is dependent upon this principal.” – Robert Penn Warren “What most people don't understand is that UFOs are on a cosmic tourist route. That's why they're always seen in Arizona, Scotland, and New Mexico. Another thing to consider is that all three of those destinations are good places to play golf. So there's possibly some connection between aliens and golf.” – Alice Cooper "Iran has elected a new president named Hassan Rohani. Yesterday he promised that he will boldly lead Iran into the 14th century.” - David Letterman “To appreciate nonsense requires a serious interest in life.” – Gelett Burgess “He does not seem to me to be a free man who does not sometimes do nothing.” – Cicero "During the cold war, West Berlin was an 'exclave' – a tiny outpost of liberalism surrounded by people who want to crush it. It was like Austin, Texas." - Craig Ferguson “It would be a bitter cosmic joke if we destroy ourselves due to atrophy of the imagination.” – Martha Gellhorn “In this fool's paradise, he drank delight.” – George Crabbe “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 “The poppy opes her scarlet purse of dreams.” – Scharmel Iris

Topic.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck

Message.Msg: You have the right to be refunded any part of your dues that goes for political activity. You may have to go to court to get it though. I'll bet you have an "Agency Shop" and are required to pay dues whether a member or not. I had quit the union prior to retiring. Just a few months before I retired I found out about having political funds returned to me. I requested they do so. They simply ignored me. Should have sued the daylights out of them but was retiring and just didn't want the hassle.

Topic.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck

Message.Msg: quit your job! works everytime.

Topic.Title: how do i stop my union from taking dues out of my paycheck

Message.Msg: Replace your reps or grease them better than ATT or the contractors are.
